sentences.sContent: Many people suffer from very serious acrophobia.
sentences.sContent_eng: Many people suffer from very serious acrophobia.
sentences.sCn: 许多人患有严重的恐高症。

sentences.sContent: She has acrophobia and always becomes dizzy in a high-rise elevator.
sentences.sContent_eng: She has acrophobia and always becomes dizzy in a high-rise elevator.
sentences.sCn: 她有恐高症，到了高楼的电梯里就发晕。

sentences.sContent: The study involved 40 people with clinically diagnosed acrophobia -- fear of heights -- all of whom took three "virtual" outdoor elevator rides.
sentences.sContent_eng: The study involved 40 people with clinically diagnosed acrophobia -- fear of heights -- all of whom took three "virtual" outdoor elevator rides.
sentences.sCn: 该研究所采用的对象是40位在临床已经确诊的恐高症患者。 将他们都带到三个“真实的”开放式电梯旁。

trans.tranOther: abnormal fear or dread of being at a great height
